sentences.en: ...the two main groups contending for power.
Economics must still contend with scarcity as a basic fact of life.
sentences.cn: 经济学仍然必须和稀缺相周旋,把稀缺当作生活中一种基本的事实.

sentences.en: He has too much to contend with.
I have to contend with difficulties.
I would contend that the minister's thinking is flawed on this point.
sentences.cn: 我倒认为部长的想法在这一点上有漏洞。

sentences.en: Inevitably, fights break out between the members of contending groups.
sentences.cn: 争权夺利的几个团体之间不可避免地发生了打斗。

sentences.en: It is time, once again, to contend with racism.
sentences.cn: 又一次到了与种族主义战斗的时刻了。

sentences.en: Small-market clubs such as the Kansas City Royals have had trouble contending with richer teams for championships.
sentences.cn: 像堪萨斯城皇家队这样市场规模较小的俱乐部一直难以同财力更雄厚的球队争夺冠军。

sentences.en: Some astronomers contend that the universe may be younger than previously thought.
sentences.cn: 有些天文学家声称宇宙可能比原先认为的要年轻。

sentences.en: Some researchers contend that carcinogens may turn healthy cells into cancer cells.
sentences.cn: 有些研究人员认为,致癌物质能使健康细胞变成癌细胞.

sentences.en: The asylum seekers had to contend with continued bureaucratic obstruction.
sentences.cn: 寻求政治庇护的人得不断地应付官僚主义的层层阻挠.

sentences.en: The competitors had to contend with squally weather conditions.
sentences.cn: 参赛者不得不应付狂风肆虐的天气条件。

sentences.en: The firm is too small to contend against [ with ] large international companies.
sentences.cn: 这家公司太小,无法与国际性的大公司 抗争.

sentences.en: The firm is too small to contend against large international companies.
sentences.cn: 这家公司太小,无法与国际性的大公司竞争.

sentences.en: They contend that the company failed to disclose material information.
sentences.cn: 他们坚持认为该公司并未透露实质性的信息。

sentences.en: They had to contend against drought.
sentences.cn: 他们必须跟干旱作斗争.

sentences.en: They have to contend against drought every year.
sentences.cn: 他们每年都得与干旱做斗争。

sentences.en: We have had to contend with the disinterest of much of the medical profession about this topic.
sentences.cn: 我们必须全力对付很多医疗界人士对这一话题的冷漠。

sentences.en: When a marriage ends, the former husband and wife often contend over the children.
sentences.cn: 夫妇双方在婚姻破裂后, 往往会争夺子女.

words.tran_cn: 诉讼的；有异议的，引起争论的；爱争论的

trans.tran_en: to compete against someone in order to gain something
to compete against someone in order to gain something
to argue or state that something is true
